title: Rahul Dravid
summary: Rahul Dravid is a former Indian cricketer and captain, widely regarded as one of the greatest batsmen in the history of cricket.

Rahul Dravid was born in 1972 in Indore, and raised in Bengaluru.

Dravid made his international debut in 1996 in an ODI against Sri Lanka in the Singer Cup held in Singapore

Arjuna Awards are given by the Government for outstanding achievement in sports

The ICC Cricket Hall of Fame recognises the achievements of the cricketing legends.
Dravid scored nearly 25000 runs in international cricket.
Dravid has scored five double centuries in Test matches
Dravid held the record for the most number of catches taken by a player (non-wicket-keeper) in Test cricket, with 210 catches.
Dravid and VVS Laxman played a 376 run partnership during a test match against Australia, which was won by India by 171 runs.
Dravid put up a partnership of 331 runs with Tendulkar which was a world record
